name: rngorn1
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c1))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(cdm(cdm(c1)), cdm(cdm(c2))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c1)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → dom(dom(c1))= dom(dom(c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c1))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(cdm(cdm(c1)), cdm(cdm(c2))))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c1)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → dom(dom(c1))= dom(dom(c2)))

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c1))), wcel(c1, cgr))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ RingOps, ran(c1)= dom(dom(c1)), c1 ∈ GrpOp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c1))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cgr))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cgr), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c1))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c1)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ (c1 ∈ GrpOp → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(cdm(cdm(c1)), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cgr))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cgr), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c1))))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → dom(dom(c1))= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → c1 ∈ GrpOp)
⊣ (c1 ∈ GrpOp → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wcel(c1, cgr))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(cdm(cdm(c1)), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wi(wcel(c1, cgr), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c1))))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → dom(dom(c1))= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ (c1 ∈ GrpOp → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c1)))
⊣ c1 =(1st ` c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(cdm(cdm(c1)), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ RingOps → dom(dom(c1))= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ c1 =(1st ` c0)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(cdm(cdm(c1)), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(c2nd, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → dom(dom(c1))= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ c2 =(2nd ` c0)
⊣ c1 =(1st ` c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crngo), wceq(crn(c1), cdm(cdm(c2))))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(c2nd, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ RingOps → ran(c1)= dom(dom(c2)))
⊣ c1 =(1st ` c0)
⊣ c2 =(2nd ` c0)

comment: In a unital ring the range of the addition equals the domain of the first variable of the multiplication. (Contributed by FL, 24-Jan-2010.) (New usage is discouraged.)
